title: No Jab No Play for early childhood education and care services
author: Department; Australia
description: No jab no play guidance for staff of early childhood education and care services.
cleaned_text: No Jab, No Play legislation requires parents/carers to provide evidence that their child has received all the vaccines they need and can confirm enrolment in a service. Following enrolment parents are required to keep this evidence up to date with the service. [ Immunisation ](/immunisation/before-enrolment-no-jab-no-play-requirements) Before enrolment - 'No Jab, No Play' requirements A guide to the requirements on your service and to helping parents/carers meet their requirements, including what to do if they're unable to provide an immunisation history statement. [ Immunisation ](/immunisation/after-enrolment-no-jab-no-play-requirements) After enrolment - 'No Jab, No Play' requirements Steps and what to do if children are enrolled under the 16-week 'support/grace' period; and help with requesting up-to-date immunisation evidence for enrolled children. [ Immunisation ](/immunisation/resources-for-no-jab-no-play) Resources for 'No Jab, No Play' Guidance and resources for early childhood education and care services to meet their obligations under No Jab No Play legislation. [ Immunisation ](/immunisation/services-and-contacts-for-no-jab-no-play) Services and contacts for 'No Jab, No Play' Includes where to refer parents/carers for health advice, contacts for specialist support services for vulnerable families and government contacts. Parents/carers should visit the [Better Health Channel - 'No Jab, No Play'](https://www.betterhealth.vic.gov.au/campaigns/no-jab-no-play). Immunisation Providers should access the ['No Jab, No Play' fact sheet for immunisation providers](https://www2.health.vic.gov.au/about/publications/factsheets/no-jab-no-play-information-for-immunisation-providers).
